destination.name: Taj Mahal
destination.description: The Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum on the right bank of the river Yamuna. It was commissioned in 1631 by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan to house the tomb of his favourite wife, Mumtaz Mahal. A UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the Seven Wonders of the World.

destination.name: Agra Fort
destination.description: Agra Fort is a historical fort in the city of Agra. It was the main residence of the emperors of the Mughal Dynasty until 1638. A UNESCO World Heritage site, it is located about 2.5 km northwest of its more famous sister monument, the Taj Mahal.

destination.name: Goa Beaches
destination.description: Goa is famous for its pristine beaches with golden sands and azure waters. Popular beaches include Baga, Calangute, Anjuna, and Palolem. Perfect for water sports, beach parties, and relaxation.

destination.name: Manali
destination.description: Manali is a high-altitude Himalayan resort town famous for its cool climate and snow-capped mountains. Popular for skiing, paragliding, river rafting, and trekking. The Solang Valley and Rohtang Pass are major attractions.

destination.name: Jaipur City Palace
destination.description: The City Palace in Jaipur is a magnificent palace complex that showcases the rich history of the royal family. It includes Chandra Mahal and Mubarak Mahal palaces and other buildings. A blend of Rajasthani and Mughal architecture.

destination.name: Kerala Backwaters
destination.description: The Kerala Backwaters are a network of brackish lagoons and lakes lying parallel to the Arabian Sea coast. Famous for houseboat cruises, lush greenery, and serene natural beauty. A unique ecosystem with rich biodiversity.

destination.name: Varanasi Ghats
destination.description: Varanasi, also known as Kashi, is one of the oldest living cities in the world. The ghats along the Ganges River are famous for spiritual ceremonies, particularly the evening Ganga Aarti. A major pilgrimage destination for Hindus.

destination.name: Ladakh
destination.description: Ladakh is a region known for its stunning landscapes, Buddhist monasteries, and adventure activities. Famous for Pangong Lake, Nubra Valley, and high-altitude mountain passes. Perfect for biking, trekking, and photography.

destination.name: Mysore Palace
destination.description: The Mysore Palace is a historical palace and a royal residence. It is the official residence of the Wadiyar dynasty. The palace is illuminated on Sundays and during festivals with nearly 100,000 light bulbs. An architectural marvel of Indo-Saracenic style.

destination.name: Rishikesh
destination.description: Rishikesh is a city in India's northern state of Uttarakhand, known as the 'Yoga Capital of the World'. Located in the foothills of the Himalayas beside the Ganges River, it's famous for yoga ashrams, meditation centers, and adventure sports like river rafting.
